### MIIsInTerminatorSequence() {#ad007531739421e7b54a41c3fefaefa4e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool MIIsInTerminatorSequence (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Given that the input MI is before a partial terminator sequence TSeq, return true if M + TSeq also a partial terminator sequence.

A Terminator sequence is a sequence of MachineInstrs which at this point in lowering copy vregs into physical registers, which are then passed into terminator instructors so we can satisfy ABI constraints. A partial terminator sequence is an improper subset of a terminator sequence (i.e. it may be the whole terminator sequence).

Definition at line <a href="#l00053">53</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegencommonisel-cpp">CodeGenCommonISel.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### salvageDebugInfoImpl() {#a2421207fa48520a2c9ab4531bc2b96f8}

  labels = {["static"]}>

<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Find the split point at which to splice the end of BB into its success stack</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">/// protector check machine basic block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">/// On many platforms, due to ABI constraints, terminators, even before register</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">/// allocation, use physical registers. This creates an issue for us since</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">/// physical registers at this point can not travel across basic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">/// blocks. Luckily, selectiondag always moves physical registers into vregs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">/// when they enter functions and moves them through a sequence of copies back</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">/// into the physical registers right before the terminator creating a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#96;&#96;Terminator Sequence&#39;&#39;. This function is searching for the beginning of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">/// terminator sequence so that we can ensure that we splice off not just the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">/// terminator, but additionally the copies that move the vregs into the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">/// physical registers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
